title: 110_hr2536
content: The Act may be cited as the "HOPE VI Green Building and Technical Assistance Act of 2007" and includes requirements for green communities. The "HOPE VI Green Building and Technical Assistance Act of 2007" includes requirements for green communities, such as compliance with the national Green Communities program criteria for affordable housing in revitalization plans to receive grants under Section 24(e) of the United States Housing Act of 1937. The HOPE VI Green Building and Technical Assistance Act of 2007 mandates compliance with the green communities criteria checklist for revitalization plans to receive grants under the United States Housing Act of 1937. Compliance with mandatory and nonmandatory items of the checklist is required to earn points for green initiatives. The HOPE VI Green Building and Technical Assistance Act of 2007 requires compliance with a green communities checklist to earn points for green initiatives in revitalization plans under the United States Housing Act of 1937. Plans must earn a minimum of 25 points for new construction or 20 points for rehabilitation, and nonresidential structures over 50,000 square feet must comply with the plan. The HOPE VI Green Building and Technical Assistance Act of 2007 mandates compliance with LEED green building rating systems for revitalization plans funded by grants under the United States Housing Act of 1937. The Secretary will verify that plans meet the requirements for certification levels. The Secretary will verify compliance with LEED green building rating systems for revitalization plans funded by grants under the United States Housing Act of 1937. Verification procedures will ensure compliance at specific times for each grantee. The United States Housing Act of 1937 amends selection criteria to include compliance with Green Communities criteria checklist for revitalization programs funded by grants. The United States Housing Act of 1937 amends Section 24(m) to allocate at least two percent of funds for planning and technical assistance grants to potential applicants, applicants, and recipients of grants for revitalization programs.
